page.title: 03THE TOTLEY TUNNEL
page.content: To secure a shorter rail route to Manchester, the Midland Railway Company planned a new line from Dore} to Chinley via the Hope Valley and Edale.Work began in 1888 and required a 3 mile tunnel under Totley Moor.It took six years to build during which there were severe problems with water. The coming of the railway brought many changes to the village of Totley. Evidence of some of these can still be seen.They include a row of cottages to house the tunnel workmen and several spoil heaps which are now covered by silver birch trees and undergrowth. The line still carries passenger and freight traffic to the Manchester area but the Dore and Totley Station is closed.
